meanings.definition: relating to or denoting a human-made material or synthetic process that imitates nature
meanings.sent1: The biomimetic design of the building helped it blend in with the surrounding trees.
meanings.sent2: The researchers used biomimetic materials to create a new type of waterproof coating.
meanings.sent3: The biomimetic paint looked so realistic that birds tried to land on it!
meanings.sent4: Her biomimetic approach to architecture was praised for its innovative use of natural forms.
meanings.sent5: The biomimetic fabric felt just like real silk, but it was actually made from recycled plastic bottles.

meanings.definition: a substance or process that imitates a natural biological process or structure
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied a biomimetic that could help improve wound healing in patients.
meanings.sent2: The company developed a new biomimetic inspired by the way bees build their hives.
meanings.sent3: The biomimetic in the lab was so effective that it made the other researchers jealous!
meanings.sent4: The artist's sculpture was a beautiful biomimetic of a flower, made entirely from metal.
meanings.sent5: The biomimetic used in the experiment replicated the behavior of a certain type of fish with incredible accuracy.
